CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PSFDTBT
2. o-dichlorobenzene (DCB)
3. PC71BM
4. [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM)
5. [6,6]phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)
6. spirobifluorene
7. thiophene
8. benzothiadiazole

These are the names of specific materials mentioned in the paragraph, which are relevant to the discussion of polymer solar cells and their components.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Name in the given paragraph:

1. PSFDTBT
2. PC71BM
3. spirobifluorene

These three entities are the names of specific materials mentioned in the paragraph, and they are relevant to the discussion of polymer solar cells and their components.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities from the paragraph, presented in the same words as in the original paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| spirobifluorene |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

1. Identify the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

* PSFDTBT (spirobifluorene-based conjugated polymer)
* PC71BM (electron acceptor)
* o-dichlorobenzene (DCB) (solvent)
* [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM) (electron acceptor)
* [6,6]phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) (electron acceptor)
2. Identify the property names of the materials:

* PSFDTBT:
 + Optical band gap: 1.97 eV
 + Low-lying HOMO energy level: -5.4 eV
 + Hole mobility: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
 + On/off ratios: 10^5
* PC71BM:
 + Electron acceptor
* o-Dichlorobenzene (DCB):
 + Solvent
* [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM):
 + Electron acceptor
* [6,6]phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM):
 + Electron acceptor
3. Identify the property values of the materials:

* PSFDTBT:
 + Optical band gap: 1.97 eV
 + Low-lying HOMO energy level: -5.4 eV
 + Hole mobility: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
 + On/off ratios: 10^5
* PC71BM:
 + Not specified
* o-Dichlorobenzene (DCB):
 + Not specified
* [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM):
 + Not specified
* [6,6]phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM):
 + Not specified

Note: The property values for PC71BM, o-dichlorobenzene (DCB), [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM), and [6,6]phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) are not specified in the given paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here's the updated list of entities that refer to Property Name of Material:

1. Optical band gap
2. Low-lying HOMO energy level
3. Hole mobility
4. On/off ratios

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to Property Name of Material:

1. PC71BM (electron acceptor)
2. o-Dichlorobenzene (DCB) (solvent)
3. [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM) (electron acceptor)
4. [6,6]phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) (electron acceptor)

Please let me know if you have any further questions or if there's anything else I can help you with.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities presented in the same words as in the original paragraph:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Optical band gap |
| Low-lying HOMO energy level |
| Hole mobility |
| On/off ratios |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

1. First, let's identify the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

* Optical band gap (Eg)
* Low-lying HOMO energy level (EHOMO)
* Hole mobility (μh)
* Open-circuit voltage (Voc)
* Power conversion efficiency (PCE)
* Highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO)
* Lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO)
2. Next, let's identify the values of these material properties:

* Optical band gap (Eg): 1.97 eV
* Low-lying HOMO energy level (EHOMO): -5.4 eV
* Hole mobility (μh): 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
* Open-circuit voltage (Voc): 0.94 V
* Power conversion efficiency (PCE): 4.6%
* Highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO): not explicitly mentioned, but it can be inferred to be around -5.4 eV (the energy level of the low-lying HOMO)
* Lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO): not explicitly mentioned, but it can be inferred to be around 1.97 eV (the energy gap of the optical band gap)

So, the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph are:

* Eg = 1.97 eV
* EHOMO = -5.4 eV
* μh = 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
* Voc = 0.94 V
* PCE = 4.6%
* HOMO = around -5.4 eV
* LUMO = around 1.97 eV
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here's the updated list of entities that refer to the value of material properties:

1. Eg = 1.97 eV (optical band gap)
2. EHOMO = -5.4 eV (low-lying HOMO energy level)
3. μh = 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (hole mobility)
4. Voc = 0.94 V (open-circuit voltage)
5. PCE = 4.6% (power conversion efficiency)

I removed the following entities from the list as they do not clearly refer to the value of material properties:

* HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital)
* LUMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital)

These entities are mentioned in the paragraph, but their values are not explicitly given. Therefore, they cannot be considered as values of material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities presented as a Property Value:

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Eg = 1.97 eV |
| EHOMO = -5.4 eV |
| μh = 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 |
| Voc = 0.94 V |
| PCE = 4.6% |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
